# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the implementation of the `wrap_string` function, considering the requirements:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, r"\s+"))
    lines = String[]
    
    current_line_length = 0
    
    for word in words
        if current_line_length + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line_)
            current_line_length = 0
        end
        
        current_line_ *= string(" ", word))
        current_line_length += length(word)
    end
    
    if !isempty(current_line_)
        push!(lines, current_line_)
    end
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
text = "This is a very long sentence that needs to be wrapped to fit within the specified text width."

wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

The output will be the `text` wrapped according to the `text_width`.
